page.title: 02WARDOUR CHAPEL
page.content: {Wardour Chapel}was built in{1776. }It is called the{Church of All Saints.}It is a very beautiful church because a very rich man (called{Lord Arundell}) built it.At that time it was the only {Catholic Church}outside{London.}The priest who generally says the Mass at {Wardour}belongs to the{Jesuit}order.{ The{Jesuits}have served in Wardour since{1640}with only short breaks. The congregation comes from up to{20 miles away to hear Mass.{150 to 200 people hear Mass in the{summer,}but there are less people in the{winter. People used to walk{5 miles}50 years ago to get to Mass.Cars make it more possible to get to church from farther away.There is one Mass on{Sunday,}and {three}during the week including the {children's Mass}on{Friday . {Shelley Bridget Laura
